intro: Euphrasia bakurianica, commonly known as the Georgian eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and mountain meadows. It features slender stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Euphrasia bakurianica is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
